trans-unit.source: Retrieves the file system's 8-byte file reference number for a file

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves the file system's 8-byte file reference number for a file

target.mrk: Retrieves the file system's 8-byte file reference number for a file

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: A handle to the file or directory whose reference number is to be retrieved.

seg-source.mrk: A handle to the file or directory whose reference number is to be retrieved.

target.mrk: A handle to the file or directory whose reference number is to be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: The 8-byte file reference number for the file.

seg-source.mrk: The 8-byte file reference number for the file.

target.mrk: The 8-byte file reference number for the file.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the NTSTATUS error code.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the NTSTATUS error code.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the NTSTATUS error code.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The file reference number is assigned by the file system and is file-system-specific.

seg-source.mrk: The file reference number is assigned by the file system and is file-system-specific.

target.mrk: The file reference number is assigned by the file system and is file-system-specific.

trans-unit.source: (Note that this is not the same as the 16-byte "file object ID" that was added to NTFS.)

seg-source.mrk: (Note that this is not the same as the 16-byte "file object ID" that was added to NTFS.)

target.mrk: (Note that this is not the same as the 16-byte "file object ID" that was added to NTFS.)

trans-unit.source: The file reference numbers, also called file IDs, are guaranteed to be unique only within a static file system.

seg-source.mrk: The file reference numbers, also called file IDs, are guaranteed to be unique only within a static file system.

target.mrk: The file reference numbers, also called file IDs, are guaranteed to be unique only within a static file system.

trans-unit.source: They are not guaranteed to be unique over time, because file systems are free to reuse them.

seg-source.mrk: They are not guaranteed to be unique over time, because file systems are free to reuse them.

target.mrk: They are not guaranteed to be unique over time, because file systems are free to reuse them.

trans-unit.source: Nor are they guaranteed to remain constant.

seg-source.mrk: Nor are they guaranteed to remain constant.

target.mrk: Nor are they guaranteed to remain constant.

trans-unit.source: For example, the FAT file system generates the file reference number for a file from the byte offset of the file's directory entry record (DIRENT) on the disk.

seg-source.mrk: For example, the FAT file system generates the file reference number for a file from the byte offset of the file's directory entry record (DIRENT) on the disk.

target.mrk: For example, the FAT file system generates the file reference number for a file from the byte offset of the file's directory entry record (DIRENT) on the disk.

trans-unit.source: Defragmentation can change this byte offset.

seg-source.mrk: Defragmentation can change this byte offset.

target.mrk: Defragmentation can change this byte offset.

trans-unit.source: Thus a FAT file reference number can change over time.

seg-source.mrk: Thus a FAT file reference number can change over time.

target.mrk: Thus a FAT file reference number can change over time.
